intro: Senecio littoreus var. littoreus, commonly known as sea lettuce, is a coastal plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its bright green, leafy appearance and its ability to thrive in saline environments. The plant forms dense mats on rocky shores and is often submerged during high tides. It plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems by preventing erosion and providing habitat for small marine organisms. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it an important species in intertidal zones.
